verses.esv: 15 No longer do I call you servants, for the servant does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, for all that I have heard from my Father I have made known to you.
verses.kjv: 15 Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.
verses.niv: 15 I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master's business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from my Father I have made known to you.

verses.esv: 13 Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.
verses.kjv: 13 Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
verses.niv: 13 Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.

verses.esv:
24   A man of many companions may come to ruin,
    but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.kjv: 24 A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
verses.niv: 24 A man of many companions may come to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

verses.esv:
17   A friend loves at all times,
    and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.kjv: 17 A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.niv: 17 A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

verses.esv: 23 and the Scripture was fulfilled that says, “Abraham believed God, and it was counted to him as righteousness”—and he was called a friend of God.
verses.kjv: 23 And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.
verses.niv: 23 And the scripture was fulfilled that says, "Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness," and he was called God's friend.

verses.esv:
17   Iron sharpens iron,
    and one man sharpens another.
verses.kjv: 17 Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
verses.niv: 17 As iron sharpens iron, so one man sharpens another.

verses.esv: 14 You are my friends if you do what I command you.
verses.kjv: 14 Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.
verses.niv: 14 You are my friends if you do what I command.

verses.esv:
26   One who is righteous is a guide to his neighbor,
    but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
verses.kjv: 26 The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
verses.niv: 26 A righteous man is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.

verses.esv:
24   Make no friendship with a man given to anger,
    nor go with a wrathful man,
25   lest you learn his ways
    and entangle yourself in a snare.
verses.kjv: 24 Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go: 25 Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
verses.niv: 24 Do not make friends with a hot-tempered man, do not associate with one easily angered, 25 or you may learn his ways and get yourself ensnared.

verses.esv: 4 You adulterous people! Do you not know that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Therefore whoever wishes to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.
verses.kjv: 4 Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
verses.niv: 4 You adulterous people, don't you know that friendship with the world is hatred toward God? Anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.

verses.esv: 33 Do not be deceived: “Bad company ruins good morals.”
verses.kjv: 33 Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
verses.niv: 33 Do not be misled: "Bad company corrupts good character."

verses.esv:
28   A dishonest man spreads strife,
    and a whisperer separates close friends.
verses.kjv: 28 A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
verses.niv: 28 A perverse man stirs up dissension, and a gossip separates close friends.

verses.esv:
9   Oil and perfume make the heart glad,
    and the sweetness of a friend comes from his earnest counsel.
verses.kjv: 9 Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.
verses.niv: 9 Perfume and incense bring joy to the heart, and the pleasantness of one's friend springs from his earnest counsel.

verses.esv:
20   Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise,
    but the companion of fools will suffer harm.
verses.kjv: 20 He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
verses.niv: 20 He who walks with the wise grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.

verses.esv:
5   Better is open rebuke
    than hidden love.
6   Faithful are the wounds of a friend;
    profuse are the kisses of an enemy.
verses.kjv: 5 Open rebuke is better than secret love. 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.niv: 5 Better is open rebuke than hidden love. 6 Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.

verses.esv: 12 “This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you. 13 Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends. 14 You are my friends if you do what I command you. 15 No longer do I call you servants, for the servant does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, for all that I have heard from my Father I have made known to you.
verses.kjv: 12 This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you. 13 Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends. 14 Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you. 15 Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.
verses.niv: 12 My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. 13 Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends. 14 You are my friends if you do what I command. 15 I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master's business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from my Father I have made known to you.

verses.esv:
6   Faithful are the wounds of a friend;
    profuse are the kisses of an enemy.
verses.kjv: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.niv: 6 Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.

verses.esv: 11 Now when Job’s three friends heard of all this evil that had come upon him, they came each from his own place, Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. They made an appointment together to come to show him sympathy and comfort him.
verses.kjv: 11 Now when Job’s three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon him, they came every one from his own place; Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite: for they had made an appointment together to come to mourn with him and to comfort him.
verses.niv: 11 When Job's three friends, Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite, heard about all the troubles that had come upon him, they set out from their homes and met together by agreement to go and sympathize with him and comfort him.

verses.esv: 8 Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.
verses.kjv: 8 Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.
verses.niv: 8 Come near to God and he will come near to you. Wash your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.

verses.esv: 2 And Elijah said to Elisha, “Please stay here, for the LORD has sent me as far as Bethel.” But Elisha said, “As the LORD lives, and as you yourself live, I will not leave you.” So they went down to Bethel.
verses.kjv: 2 And Elijah said unto Elisha, Tarry here, I pray thee; for the LORD hath sent me to Bethel. And Elisha said unto him, As the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they went down to Bethel.
verses.niv: 2 Elijah said to Elisha, "Stay here; the LORD has sent me to Bethel." But Elisha said, "As surely as the LORD lives and as you live, I will not leave you." So they went down to Bethel.

verses.esv: 18:1 As soon as he had finished speaking to Saul, the soul of Jonathan was knit to the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul. 2 And Saul took him that day and would not let him return to his father’s house. 3 Then Jonathan made a covenant with David, because he loved him as his own soul.
verses.kjv: 1 And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul, that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul. 2 And Saul took him that day, and would let him go no more home to his father’s house. 3 Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul.
verses.niv: 1 After David had finished talking with Saul, Jonathan became one in spirit with David, and he loved him as himself. 2 From that day Saul kept David with him and did not let him return to his father's house. 3 And Jonathan made a covenant with David because he loved him as himself.

verses.esv: 28 Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
verses.kjv: 28 Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
verses.niv: 28 "Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.

verses.esv: 8 but God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
verses.kjv: 8 But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.
verses.niv: 8 But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.

verses.esv: 3:1 See what kind of love the Father has given to us, that we should be called children of God; and so we are. The reason why the world does not know us is that it did not know him.
verses.kjv: 1 Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew him not.
verses.niv: 1 How great is the love the Father has lavished on us, that we should be called children of God! And that is what we are! The reason the world does not know us is that it did not know him.

verses.esv: 20 Behold, I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in to him and eat with him, and he with me.
verses.kjv: 20 Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.
verses.niv: 20 Here I am! I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in and eat with him, and he with me.
